q: `` Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti,'' Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. There is really no one else in the universe that could have accomplished what Eric Schmidt has done, Page said. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies.

Google is the second tech giant in less than a week to surprise investors with a CEO change. - ranging from the established to the extreme- defined the announcement more by skin color than ideology. The most crass interpretation came from talk radio host Rush Limbaugh , who wrote the Politico's Jonathan Martin the following: Dick Cheney Colin Powell says his endorsement is not about race... OK, fine. I am now researching his past endorsements to see if I can find all the inexperienced, very liberal, white candidates he has endorsed. I'll let you know what I come up with. Around the same time, esteemed conservative columnist George Will was also explaining Colin Powell 's decision as part of a larger, more psychological sway that Barack Obama held over other African Americans. Eagles quarterbacks- Michael Vick and Kevin Kolb - were sacked 50 times last season, the second most in the league. Michael Vick was decked 34 times in 372 attempts, or once every 10.9 throws. said:`` I love The Hoff.'' The first of the judges to arrive was motormouth comic Michael McIntyre , 34, who knew exactly what he was after from the Scottish acts. He said: We've had Subo then we had Janey Cutler.`` This year I'm looking for an even older woman.`` They are getting older and older.`` I'm hoping for a 98-year-old woman to just turn up and blow the roof off the Armadillo. Michael McIntyre and The Hoff took over judges' duties from Piers Morgan and Simon Cowell , who will return for the live TV shows. Also gee-ing up the crowd were pint-sized Geordie presenters Ant and Dec.
